name: wheat stitch™ pickle ornament
notes:
❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

get ready to add a dash of tradition and a sprinkle of silliness to your holiday décor with the **wheat stitch crochet pickle ornament**! crafted in my [***signature wheat stitch™***][1] texture, this festive favorite is quick, quirky, and guaranteed to put a smile on everyone's face.

we’re keepin’ it simple — and a little silly — just like a christmas pickle should be! you’ll start with a basic chain and work a fun, easy 4-row repeat to create a soft, textured rectangle. once that’s done, join the long edges to form a tube (hello, pickle shape!), seam the top closed, and add a twine loop so it can dangle proudly on your christmas tree. finish it off with a bit of stuffing and close the bottom — boom, you’ve officially crocheted a holiday legend. and don’t forget to add one of the adorable (and punny) printable gift tags for the final flourish!

perfect for quick handmade gifts, white elephant exchanges, or adding a touch of cheeky charm to your christmas tree, this pickle ornament is as fun to make as it is to share.

[a video tutorial is included.][2]

**crochet hook:** 
[g (4.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers][4]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5]
[scissors][6]
[string for tags][7]
[fiberfill][8]

**yarn:**
[malabrigo rios][9] - 100% superwash merino wool, 210yds/100g

**yarn quantities:**
25 yards per pickle

**yarn substitutions:**
[herrschners worsted 8 heathers][10] - 100% acrylic, 489yds/226g
[lion brand heartland][11] - 100% acrylic, 251yds/142g
[herrschners worsted 8 sparkle][12] - 92% acrylic/8% polyester, 489ds/226g
[mary maxim maximum value][13] - 100% acrylic; 474yds/227g
[herrschners supreme worsted][14] - 100% acrylic, 169yds/100g

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this pattern
15 sts and 13 rows = 4" by 4" in stitch pattern repeat, not blocked.

[not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][15]

**sizes:**
one size; adjustable

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
